FuncDef:
The ds-lite session-limit command enables the limitation on the maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions, or sets the maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions that can be established for each user.
The undo ds-lite session-limit command disables the limitation on the maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions, or restores the default upper limit.

By default, the limitation on the user-based user-to-network DS-Lite session number is enabled. The maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions for each user of a specific or all three protocols is as follows:

TCP or UDP: 10240

ICMP: 512

TCP, UDP, and ICMP: 8192



If the total parameter is set, this parameter takes precedence.
CLIs: ds-lite session-limit { enable | icmp <session-number> | tcp <session-number> | total <session-number> | udp <session-number> }
undo ds-lite session-limit { enable | { icmp | tcp | total | udp } [ <session-number> ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables the limitation on the maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions.
-

Indicates the maximum number of ICMP user-to-network DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of TCP user-to-network DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of all sessions for each user.If the total number of TCP, UDP, and ICMP user-to-network IP sessions for each user reaches the maximum number, DS-Lite cannot be performed even if the number of TCP, UDP, or ICMP user-to-network IP sessions for each user has not reached the maximum number.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of UDP user-to-network DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the ds-lite session-limit enable command is run in the DS-Lite instance view, the system will allow the creation of only a specified number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions.
Some unauthorized users may consume a lot of session resources to attack devices. As a result, there is a possibility that no session can be used by authorized users for DS-Lite. To prevent this, run the ds-lite session-limit command to limit the number of sessions that can be used. A forward session is established for packets transmitted from the user side to the network side.
Configuration Impact
When the number of DS-Lite sessions of a user reaches the upper limit, additional DS-Lite sessions cannot be established. After existing DS-Lite sessions age and the number of established sessions falls below the upper limit, new sessions can be established for the user.
Precautions
The configured the maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions that can be established can take effect only after the ds-lite session-limit enable command is run.
